titleStmt.title: A dyaloge of syr Thomas More knyghte: one of the counsayll of oure souerayne lorde the kyng [and] chauncellour of hys duchy of Lancaster. Wherin be treated dyuers maters, as of the veneration [and] worshyp of ymages [and] relyques, prayng to sayntys, [and] goyng o[n] pylgrymage. Wyth many othere thyngys touching the pestylent sect of Luther and Tyndale, by the tone bygone in Sarony, and by tother laboryed to be brought in to Englond
Dyaloge of dyvers maters
titleStmt.author: More, Thomas, Sir, Saint, 1478-1535.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By J. Rastell] at the sygne of the meremayd at Powlys gate next to chepe syde in the moneth of June,
publicationStmt.date: the yere of our lord. M. [and] C.xxix. [1529]]

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from colophon; printer's name from STC.
Errata on verso of y5, final leaf.
Print faded and show-through; several leaves stained.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: the sygne of the meremayd at Powlys gate next to chepe syde in the moneth of June
